lines.text: MOBA MEDIA INC
Oregon's broadcast monitoring service
BOX 4653
PORTLAND OR
AOI TAKES POSITIONS
KXL AM RADIO
3 OCTOBER 88
NEWSCASTER: A ballot measure requiring the use of auto seatbelts has
drawn the endorsement of the state's largest business organization, but the
group rejected a proposal that would ban smoking in public buildings.
Directors of Associated Oregon Industries decided yesterday the group's
positions on the eight ballot measures that will face a statewide vote November
8th. Spokesman Jack Zimmerman says they oppose Measure 6, which would
prohibit smoking in public buildings on the basis clean air statutes are
working.
The directors also oppose Measures 5, 7, and 8. Measure 5 would increase beer
and cigarette taxes to fund collegiate athletics. Measure 7 would prohibit dam
building and mining along 11 rivers. Measure 8 would repeal a governor's
order banning discrimination in the state's executive branch based on sexual
orientation.
Marerial supplied by Moba Media, Ine of Portland, Oregon may be used for intemal revierw,
analysis, or research. Any publication. rebroadcast, or public display for profit is forbidden.
